Posts.Content: I had chemo, double mastectomy then 25 sessions of radiotherapy to "mop up" anything that may have got astray as my cancer had spread to lymph glands. I wanted everything they offered to make sure I give as good as a fight as I possible could. Good luck with your treatment
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: Hi KateG, thank you for your reply...I have a few issues with Tamoxifen, the main one being that I have a family history of uterus cancer and knowing that Tamoxifen raises the risk of getting this cancer is a big concern. I am struggling with the side effects, sore mouth and fatigue being just 2 of them. These are the reasons I am searching for information about an alternative.
Posts.Title: Alternative to Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi, this is my first time posting on here. I have recently been swapped from Anastrozole to Tamoxifen and I'm having a nightmare :( The side effects are awful. I'm seeing my oncologist this Friday so I will be asking if there is something else I can take instead, but I'd like to go to the appointment with as much information as I can so I don't get fobbed off...Ive not found out anything yet, can anyone help?
Posts.Title: Alternative to Tamoxifen?
